answers.answer: Although I am a female, what you have mentioned to me seems to be many of the same symptoms I have had when I did have a UTI.  If that's what it is, you don't want to wait two weeks to get into a urologist though.  I'd make an appointment with my family doc ASAP.

Not a doctor here.  That said, it could be several things I can think of.If it's a UTI you may experience pain or burning on urination and possibly a fever.I'll note that there's a possibility it could be the onset of Type II diabetes (do you feel any fatigue, increased thirst, etc?).Could just be a weak bladder too.Too bad you have to wait 2 weeks, could you get in to see the GP sooner?  A GP should be able to check you for both a UTI and diabetes.Best of luck,
As we get older,our bladder will trigger a need to empty out the bladder when it is partially full,usually this happens with people over 60.

Overactive bladder syndrome, I am 40 just got diagnosed with it, your symptoms sound identical to mine, except I am female.  I am on enablex which the urologist prescribed and it took about a week to work, but now is working excellent. I also didn't have leaking of urine or sudden urges, but I felt the urge to go very soon after just going.  The urologist said that happens to many.  This isn't just an old person thing anymore.  Hope this helps.  Merytre

question: 42 y.o healthy male 6'2" 180 lbs.  Cannot get in to see urologist for 2 weeks.  Symptoms over the past week include:-increased feelings to urinate resulting in many trips to bathroom.- when I urinate, I only go small amounts, unless I hold until bladder is fairly full.- I can hold without pain.- the feelings to urinate appear to come fron inside the shaft (urethra?) as opposed to the abdomen, except when I really I have a full bladder.- Urgency returns shortly after trips to restroom.- when I have these feelings to urinate, it also feels like I am dribbling to the point where I check often.  However, there is no noticaeble dribble on white underwear.-No pain in abdomen or anywhere for that matter- urine is generally clear and no blood, although over the past few weeks I have noticed it to be cloudy in the middle of the day.- noticed strong oder in urine after empying a full bladder this morning.  However, I started myself on some of my wife's Amoxil (1000 mg last night, so I don not know if the odor came from the Amoxil)Was better yesterday, but sympoms have returned.- as part of a PCP checkup 2 months ago, my bloodwork was fine, only with a very slighly elavated bilirubin, which has since gone  to the upper end of the normal range.  Prostate bloodwork was fine.I believe this may be a mild lower UTI, although urine has mostly been clear.I have also treid cranberry juice dailyThanks for your thoughts and comments.
title: too many trips to bathroom
